StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: DNA Methylomic Profiling of Preeclampsia Across Pregnancy

Person.Organization: UNIVERSITY OF PITTSBURGH AT PITTSBURGHMAGEE-WOMEN'S RES INST AND FOUNDATION

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The dataset, entitled “DNA Methylomic Profiling of Preeclampsia Across Pregnancy,” used for the analyses described in this manuscript was obtained from the database of Genotype and Phenotype (dbGaP) found at http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gap. This work was supported by grants from the Eunice Kennedy Shriver NICHD (R21 HD092770 to Mandy Jo Schmella, Ph.D.; and P01 HD030367 to Carl A. Hubel, PhD; Susan J. Fisher, PhD; James M. Roberts, MD; Robin E. Gandley, PhD; Robert W. Powers, PhD; and Arundhathi Jeyabalan, MD).
Policy.ic_specific_access_term:
Use of the dataset entitled “DNA Methylomic Profiling of Preeclampsia Across Pregnancy" requires the dissemination of the results of your study to the larger scientific community, either by publication or public presentation.
Projects on methods development that will enhance the analysis of genetic studies are allowed for this dataset.
While not specifically required, requestors of this dataset may want to consider establishing a collaboration with the primary study investigator, Dr. Mandy Schmella.
Use of this dataset is limited to not-for-profit organizations. Requests from pharmaceutical companies or other for-profit organizations will not be approved.
The progress report should specifically cite work done that relates to this dataset ["DNA Methylomic Profiling of Preeclampsia Across Pregnancy"] and not just a generic report for a series of datasets that may have been requested.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (PUB, NPU, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-PUB-NPU-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).
